Text.Value: Keep staring.
Stare at his forehead.
I'm not saying I didn't have that whole amulet situation under control, but...
I hope I don't look as old as you when I'm your age.
Kind of short for an adult, aren't you?
You're blocking my light.
You want something? Or you just here to stare at my forehead?
Your approval means bunches to me, complete stranger.
You did the right thing before - returning that locket.

EditorData.logicalname: PC saw the argument and the kid returned the locket.

Text.Value: Oh, I remember you. You're the one who made me return the ugly human's jewellery.
I'm here for the locket. Where is it?
I'm waiting on someone, and you aren't him. Do you mind?
You're the first grown-up who's ever gotten in here. Not bad.
Now, find yourself a maze and get lost. I'm busy.
This entire conversation is a waste of our time, don't you think?
Aw, go tell my parents. Wait, you can't. They're dead.
Oh, I remember you. You're the one who got me in trouble with Ikaron.
You need to learn some manners, I think.
Tell me the truth. That adventurer's locket - do you have it?

EditorData.logicalname: PC saw the argument but the kid didn't return the locket

Text.Value: Yeah, okay, fine. Very funny. What do you want?
Look, if I had it, would I tell you?
I thought I told you to get lost?
I didn't think I'd get to keep the damn thing. So... thanks. Thanks a lot.
Oh, I remember you. You're the one who helped me get away.
Oh, I remember you. You're the one who let the ugly human hit me.
Mol says you're all right. Doesn't mean I gotta talk to you.
Keep out of trouble, hey? One of us should.
Look, you seem nice and all, but take a hint, huh?
Nowhere you'd ever look. Go away.
Leave.
Hey, uh, listen.
Mol says you're dead to us. Go away, dead girl.
Mol says you're dead to us. Go away, dead boy.
Mol says you're dead to us. Go away.

Synopsis: Non-critpath. This dialogue occurs when the player speaks to the tiefling boy who stole the necklace from the adventurer. He might still have the necklace depending on the player's choices in the original dialogue.
